data.title: After Loss, Living Life ‘More Ferociously’ Together
data.meta_description: Sandra Brooke and David Gordon became each other’s source of support after their spouses died.
data.text:
It was Sandra Ludig Brooke’s first wedding anniversary without her husband of 33 years, who had died in 2019 after more than a decade of health setbacks. That same day, March 1, 2020, her friends Maggi McCormick Gordon and David Sorrell Gordon were hosting a party in Los Angeles to celebrate their own 46th wedding anniversary. Ms. Brooke debated whether to attend.

“I went, there was this lovely party and of course I cried all the way home,” she said.

The following year, in February 2021, Ms. Gordon was diagnosed with terminal breast cancer and eventually died, on June 6. At the end of a celebration of her life a few weeks later, Ms. Brooke was saying goodbye to Mr. Gordon and the two of them suggested meeting up to talk about losing a beloved partner.

“We thought it would be a nice, companionable lunch and it turned out to be quite a searing conversation about death and loss,” Ms. Brooke said.

[Click here to binge read this week’s featured couples.]

Ms. Brooke, 65, is the Avery director of the library at the Huntington Library, Art Museum, and Botanical Gardens, in San Marino, Calif. She has a bachelor’s degree in the history of art from Northwestern University, a master’s degree in the history of art from Williams College, and a master’s degree in library science from SUNY Albany. Mr. Gordon, 81, is the president of the Sierra Madre Playhouse and has a bachelor’s degree in politics, philosophy and economics from the University of Oxford.
